Read 2020 election results (democratic_vs_republican_votes_by_usa_state_2020.csv) and label each state as 'democrat' if its Democratic vote share is at least 50 %, otherwise 'republican'.
Merge the party labels into the wildfire acreage dataframe on state name with an outer join so every state remains even if one of the sources is missing an entry.
Read the file containing the total fire counts per state (wildfire_total_fires_p45_54.csv) and merge those counts into the combined dataframe on state name (outer join).
Group the merged dataframe by the party label and aggregate (sum) the column 'Total Fires' (and also sum acreage and population, though only fires are needed for the answer).
Compare the summed fire counts for the two parties to decide whether Democratic or Republican states experienced more fires.
